snippet: A longstanding Federal inquiry into corruption among California officials led today to the filing of racketeering charges against a powerful state legislator, who immediately issued a letter of resignation in which he admitted breaking the law.   ...
lead_paragraph: A longstanding Federal inquiry into corruption among California officials led today to the filing of racketeering charges against a powerful state legislator, who immediately issued a letter of resignation in which he admitted breaking the law. In a complaint filed by United States Attorney George O'Connell, State Senator Alan Robbins was charged with extorting money from special interests, engaging in obstruction of justice and filing a false tax return.

headline.main: State Senator From California Facing Racketeering Charges
